definition.title: Why Prepare Interview Questions?
definition.content: The best interview guests don't wing it—they prepare. By anticipating questions and crafting thoughtful answers, you deliver more value, stay on message, and transform every appearance into an opportunity to build authority.

landingContent.formula: Balance specific questions that demonstrate expertise with story-based questions that engage the audience.
tips: Frame questions for stories - listeners connect with narratives, not lectures
Show range and depth - mix strategic big-picture questions with tactical details
Include transformation questions - let guests describe before/after scenarios
Prepare for the unexpected - practice pivoting any question to your key messages

examples.title: Origin Questions
examples.content: What led you to develop this approach? • How did you discover this common mistake? • What was the turning point in your career?

examples.title: Process Questions
examples.content: Can you walk us through your step-by-step approach? • What does your process look like from start to finish? • How do you typically begin working with a new client?

examples.title: Results Questions
examples.content: What kind of results have your clients seen? • How does success look different after implementation? • What's the most surprising outcome you've witnessed?

faq.question: Should I include suggested answers?
faq.answer: Yes, especially for your first interview prep. The suggested answers provide helpful frameworks you can personalize with your own experiences.

faq.question: What difficulty level should I choose?
faq.answer: Start with basic for practice, then move to thought-provoking for podcasts that value deep discussions. Use intermediate for most press interviews.

faq.question: How do I use the key messages feature?
faq.answer: Enter 2-3 points you want to convey during the interview. The generator will create questions that naturally lead to these talking points.

faq.question: Can I use these for my media kit?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Many speakers include a FAQ section in their media kit to help hosts prepare for interviews.
